poem:
Rice and Peas  

On the warm, Sunday air  
a simmering pot — home, heart, heritage —  
peas dance in rice, a rhythmic sway,  
aroma rising like island tides.  
Tradition rocks gently,  
silver spoon, wooden bowl,  
love richer than any spice.  
Each grain, a story,  
each pea, a promise —  
more than a side,  
the soul of a meal.
